text: Robert Richard Dubac is an American actor, director, stand-up comedian, and playwright. Robert is known for his comedic solo show, The Male Intellect: An Oxymoron?, The Book of Moron, and Stand-Up Jesus. == Career == From 1990 to 1991, Robert was the lead actor on ABC's soap opera Loving. In 1999, Robert's first play, The Male Intellect: An Oxymoron?, co-directed by Blake Edwards, logged approximately 5000 performances worldwide and has been translated into several languages. In 2014, Robert with his friend Garry Shandling, wrote and directed his second play, The Book Of Moron. Between 2020 to 2021, Robert wrote his third show, Stand-Up Jesus. Robert also co-wrote and directed Happyville, starring Dave Shirley, and the Off-Broadway solo show Man 1, and Bank 0. == Filmography == Movies/TV Shows Character Year Diff'rent Strokes David (as Bob Dubac) 1984 Hunter Sweet Louie (as Bob Dubac) 1985 Stitches AI Rosenberg (as Bob Dubac) 1985 Mind Benders French Teacher 1987 Growing Pains Rodney Strong 1988 Life Goes On Record Producer 1989 The Rookie Waiter 1992 Loving Alex Masters 1990-1991 Sketch Artist Tommy 1992 Innocent Obsession Edward 1994 Cold Ground Mayner 1996 After the Game Clyde Walsh 1997 Too Hip for the Room Stuart 2015 The Real Geezer of Beverly Hills-Adjacent Bob 2019 == References == Category:Living people Category:American stand-up comedians Category:American movie actors Category:American playwrights Category:American television actors
title: Robert Dubac
